ReferenceDocuments.name: How [did/do] the reported val
ReferenceDocuments.description: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC SDTM Reference Range Indicator
ReferenceDocuments.description: Terminology associated with the reference range indicator codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).Indicator

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).

ReferenceDocuments.name: SRNRIND
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The category of the value within the respective reference range. Ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
